page.title: 20WYKE MIDDLE SCHOOL
page.content: The information about this block was collected and collated by fourth year children at High Fernley First School and Wyke Middle School. Education in Bradford is based on a three tier system. Pupils who attend Wyke Middle School come from three feeder first schools at the age of nine. High Fernley is one of these feeder schools. Pupils leave middle school at thirteen and most children move on to Wyke Manor Upper School. Wyke Middle is organised in four year groups with a team of teachers assigned to each. In the 1st and 2nd years, teaching is class teacher based, but years three and four spend more time with specialist teachers. Major events in this school year have been fund-raising efforts for the Ethiopian Famine Relief and the Bradford City Football Disaster.
